_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:29:24 using v2.0
title: How did NHS staff sickness rates vary by staff type?
analysis_commentary:
Absence rates also vary markedly by staff group. Reflecting the analysis by trust type, the staff group with the highest sickness absence rates are ambulance staff with an average rate of 6.20% over the same time period.

Other groups that are higher than the national average are health care assistants and other support staff, and nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff with rates of 6.19% and 5.00%, respectively.

Medical and dental staff, and nursery, midwifery and health visiting learners have considerably lower rates – at least three-fold less – than other staff groups over the analysis period, with a sickness absence rate of 1.2% and 1.1% respectively.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Sickness Absence Rates (Copyright © 2014, Health and Social Care Information Centre. All rights reserved)
